param.name: param
param.description: parameter values in KEY VALUE format

env.name: env
env.description: environment values in KEY VALUE format

web.name: web
web.description: treat ACTION as a web action or as a raw HTTP web action

web-secure.name: web-secure
web-secure.description: secure the web action (valid values are true, false, or any string)

param-file.name: param-file
param-file.description: FILE containing parameter values in JSON format

env-file.name: env-file
env-file.description: FILE containing environment variables in JSON format

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.description: the timeout LIMIT in milliseconds after which the action is terminated (default 60000)

memory.name: memory
memory.description: the maximum memory LIMIT in MB for the action (default 256)

logsize.name: logsize
logsize.description: the maximum log size LIMIT in MB for the action (default 10)

kind.name: kind
kind.description: the KIND of the action runtime (example: swift:default, nodejs:default)

annotation.name: annotation
annotation.description: annotation values in KEY VALUE format

annotation-file.name: annotation-file
annotation-file.description: FILE containing annotation values in JSON format

sequence.name: sequence
sequence.description: treat ACTION as comma separated sequence of actions to invoke

docker.name: docker
docker.description: use provided Docker image (a path on DockerHub) to run the action

native.name: native
native.description: use default skeleton runtime where code artifact provides actual executable for the action

main.name: main
main.description: the name of the action entry point (function or fully-qualified method name when applicable)

code.name: code
code.description: show action code (only works if code is not a zip file

save.name: save
save.description: save action code to file corresponding with action name

save-as.name: save-as
save-as.description: file to save action code to

param.name: param
param.description: parameter values in KEY VALUE format

param-file.name: param-file
param-file.description: FILE containing parameter values in JSON format

no-wait.name: no-wait
no-wait.description: fire and forget (asynchronous invoke, does not wait for the result)

result.name: result
result.description: invoke action and wait for the result (default)

limit.name: limit
limit.description: only return LIMIT number of actions from the collection (default 30)

skip.name: skip
skip.description: exclude the first SKIP number of actions from the result

count.name: count
count.description: show only the total number of actions

main.name: main

logs.name: logs
logs.description: emit only the logs, stripped of time stamps and stream identifier

filter.name: filter
filter.description: the name of the activations to filter on (this flag may only be used with --last)

limit.name: limit
limit.description: only return LIMIT number of activations from the collection with a maximum LIMIT of 200 activations (default 30)

skip.name: skip
skip.description: exclude the first SKIP number of activations from the result

since.name: since
since.description: return activations with timestamps later than SINCE; measured in milliseconds since Th, 01, Jan 1970

upto.name: upto
upto.description: return activations with timestamps earlier than UPTO; measured in milliseconds since Th, 01, Jan 1970

count.name: count
count.description: show only the total number of activations

runtime:activation:logs.description: Retrieves the Logs for an Activation

last.name: last
last.description: retrieves the most recent activation logs

strip.name: strip
strip.description: strip timestamp information and output first line only

count.name: count
count.description: used with --last, return the last `count` activation logs (up to 200)

filter.name: filter
filter.description: the name of the activations to filter on (this flag may only be used with --last)

runtime:activation:result.description: Retrieves the Results for an Activation

last.name: last
last.description: retrieves the most recent activation result

count.name: count
count.description: used with --last, return the last `count` activation logs (up to 200)

filter.name: filter
filter.description: the name of the activations to filter on (this flag may only be used with --last)
